references.paper_title: Unifying (machine) vision via counterfactual world modeling
references.reason: This paper presents the foundational Counterfactual World Modeling (CWM) approach that Opt-CWM builds upon.

references.paper_title: Tap-vid: A benchmark for tracking any point in a video
references.reason: This work introduces the TAP-Vid benchmark, a key real-world dataset used for evaluating the proposed Opt-CWM method.

references.paper_title: Raft: Recurrent all-pairs field transforms for optical flow
references.reason: This introduces RAFT, a supervised optical flow estimation method that is a strong baseline in the paper and is also used for distillation.

references.paper_title: Flownet: Learning optical flow with convolutional networks
references.reason: This work introduces flownet which pioneers the use of convolutional networks for optical flow, is a core task addressed in the paper.

references.paper_title: Smurf: Self-teaching multi-frame unsupervised raft with full-image warping
references.reason: This is a self-supervised optical flow method (SMURF) is a baseline used for comparison, illustrating the advancements achieved by Opt-CWM in this domain.
